name: Opticspy
body:
#opticspy Opticspy is a python module for optics application. I want to this for a long time. One reason is I know both optics and python, so why no develop some optics tools? The second reason is that there is not much opensource, easy-to-use optics program module(Matlab has great functions but do not specify to optics application). I want this module could be developed in to a core for a future web application for optics. Now it is concentrated on interferometers, optical metrology and wave propagation. And most methods in opticspy based on Zernike Polynomials. ##There are some examples opticspy module: ###1. [Zernike Polynomial Methods](http://sterncat.github.io/files/Zernike_Polynomial_Method.html) ###2. [Zernike Polynomial Fitting Methods](http://sterncat.github.io/files/Zernike_Polynomial_Fitting_Method.html) ###3. [Interferometer Methods](http://sterncat.github.io/files/Interferometer_Method.html) ###4. [Phase shift interferometer and surface rebuild](http://sterncat.github.io/files/PSI.html) ###5. [Wave Propagation and Aberration Methods](http://sterncat.github.io/files/Diffraction_Method.html) ###6. [Lens aberration, Jones matrix and gauss beam methods ](http://sterncat.github.io/files/Other_functions.html) ##There are some interesting gifs from opticspy: ###1. [Zernike Surface](http://sterncat.github.io/images/zernikegif.gif) ###This project is hosted on github in [https://github.com/Sterncat/opticspy](https://github.com/Sterncat/opticspy) ##How to use ``` >>> import opticspy ``` And just have fun with it! ## What I want
  • 1. After import the module and you will get some functions that can do some calculation and education in optics
  • 2. Parameters should be very flexible, and the results should be shown in visualized, intuitionistic figures.
  • 3. Based on Zernike Polynomials.
  • 4. After development of core, I want it be dynamic web application(with Javascript)
  • 5. I even hope one day it will become a part of online optics design application, who knows?
##TODO: * ✓ Zernike Polynomials surface(3D), map(2D), cutoff of 3D(1D) * ✓ Zernike Coefficient calculation * ✓ Zernike Polynomials Surface Fitting Method * ✓ Twyman Green interferometer * ✓ Lateral Shear interferometer * ✓ Phase shift interferometer(Several phase unwrap algorithm) * ✓ Several kinds of apertures * ✓ Apertures' Fresnel and Frauhofer diffraction pattern, OTF * ✓ Third order ray aberration, distortion and field curvature calculation * ✓ Surface based on Seidel coefficients * ✓ Zernike to Seidel coefficients interconversion * Star test * Geometric matrix calculation * Some freeform theory * PSF, OTF and MTF calculation * More interferometer(Twyman Green, Shearing, etc) * Ray tracing * high order aberration calculation * Make it rock! ##Authors and Contributors I am Xing Fan. An optics master student now studying in the [Institute of Optics](http://www.optics.rochester.edu/), [University of Rochester](http://www.rochester.edu/).
